description: Neuroscience is one of the fastest growing fields, with activity ranging from the fundamentals of
behavior to molecular aspects of neuronal function. This course provides a foundation and
overview of the important and extensive ways in which biological and physiological processes are
involved in the regulation and maintenance of behavior. Among the topics students explore are:
fundamental electrophysiology, sensory and motor systems, integration, and learning and memory.
Counts towards the Biology and Psychology majors. Prerequisites: Biology 125, or Chemistry 121
(or 125), or Chemistry/Biology 125, or Physics 130, or Psychology 125. Biology 125 is strongly
recommended. Offered annually in the Fall Semester.
